meanings.definition: A person who digs or excavates, especially in archaeology.
meanings.sent1: The fossor carefully unearthed ancient artifacts at the archaeological site.
meanings.sent2: The fossor discovered a hidden chamber while excavating the ruins.
meanings.sent3: The fossor joked that they were 'digging up the past' quite literally.
meanings.sent4: The fossor's dedication to uncovering history was as deep as the holes they dug.
meanings.sent5: The fossor's shovel moved rhythmically, revealing secrets buried for centuries.

meanings.definition: A type of beetle that burrows in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The fossor beetle disappeared underground in search of food.
meanings.sent2: Children marveled at the fossor beetle's ability to vanish into the earth.
meanings.sent3: The fossor beetle's underground home was the envy of all other insects.
meanings.sent4: The fossor beetle's tunneling skills were unmatched in the insect world.
meanings.sent5: The fossor beetle's tiny size belied its impressive digging capabilities.

meanings.sent1: The gardener relied on the trusty fossor to plant new flowers.
meanings.sent2: The fossor made quick work of turning over the soil in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The fossor was the gardener's favorite tool, always ready to dig up surprises.
meanings.sent4: The sharp edge of the fossor sliced through the earth effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The fossor's wooden handle felt smooth and sturdy in the gardener's grip.
